definitions: large body of fresh water surrounded by land in Ireland
examples: Lough Neagh is the largest freshwater lake in the British Isles
The fishermen cast their nets across the ancient lough at dawn

definitions: comfortable room in a house for relaxing and entertaining
public waiting area in airports, hotels, or other buildings
upscale bar or club with comfortable seating and relaxed atmosphere
examples: The family gathered in the lounge to watch television together
She decorated the lounge with plush sofas and warm lighting
Passengers waited in the departure lounge for their delayed flight
The hotel lounge offered complimentary coffee and newspapers to guests
They met for cocktails at the jazz lounge downtown
The lounge featured live piano music every Friday evening

definitions: small wingless parasitic insect that lives on humans or animals
unpleasant or contemptible person regarded with disgust or scorn
examples: The school nurse checked the children's hair for head lice
A single louse can lay dozens of eggs in human hair
That louse betrayed his best friend for money
Don't trust him because he's nothing but a louse

definitions: angled slat or blade in a door, shutter, or screen for ventilation
world-famous art museum located in Paris, France
examples: The louvre windows allowed air circulation while keeping rain out
Wooden louvres provided privacy without blocking the breeze completely
The Mona Lisa hangs in the Louvre Museum in Paris
Millions of tourists visit the Louvre every year

definitions: intense feeling of deep affection and care for someone
romantic and sexual attraction between people
great interest and pleasure in something
score of zero in tennis
examples: A mother's love for her children knows no bounds
Their love grew stronger through years of marriage
They fell in love during their college years together
She wrote him love letters while he was overseas
His love of music began in early childhood
She has a deep love for mountain climbing
The score was forty-love in favor of the server
She won the game six-love without dropping a point

definitions: beautiful or attractive person, typically used as an informal address
examples: Come here, my lovely, and give me a hug
The photographer worked with several lovelies for the fashion shoot

definitions: person having a sexual or romantic relationship with someone
person who likes or enjoys something very much
examples: The two lovers met secretly in the garden at midnight
She discovered her husband had taken a lover
As a nature lover, he spent weekends hiking mountain trails
Wine lovers gathered for the annual tasting festival

definitions: point, level, or figure that is the minimum reached
area of low atmospheric pressure that typically brings unsettled weather
examples: Stock prices hit a new low this quarter
Her confidence reached an all-time low after the rejection
A low is moving in from the west bringing rain
The weather low will cause storms throughout the region

definitions: the bottom or less important part of something
examples: The lower of the two shelves holds the heavy books
Pain spread through the lower of his back

definitions: small form of letters as opposed to capital letters
examples: Please write your password using both uppercase and lowercase letters
The text was printed entirely in lowercase for stylistic effect

definitions: act or process of moving something to a lower position or level
examples: The lowering of interest rates stimulated economic growth
The flag lowering ceremony occurs at sunset each day

definitions: low-lying country or region that is relatively flat
examples: Farmers cultivated rice in the fertile lowland areas
The Scottish Lowlands contrast dramatically with the Highland regions

definitions: brined salmon that is typically smoked and served on bagels
liquid oxygen used as rocket propellant in aerospace applications
examples: She ordered a bagel with lox and cream cheese for brunch
The deli serves the finest lox imported from Norway
The rocket's tanks were filled with lox before launch
Engineers monitored the lox levels during the countdown

definitions: person who remains loyal to established authority during revolt
supporter of union with Britain or retention of monarchy
examples: Loyalists fled to Canada after the American Revolution
The government troops fought against rebels while loyalists provided support
Ulster loyalists opposed Irish independence from British rule
Spanish loyalists supported the monarchy during the civil war

definitions: quality of being loyal and showing constant support to someone or something
examples: Her loyalty to the company lasted through difficult times
Dogs are famous for their unwavering loyalty to owners

definitions: small medicinal tablet that dissolves slowly in the mouth
diamond or rhombus shape used in heraldry and design
examples: She sucked on a throat lozenge to soothe her cough
The pharmacy stocks various lozenges for cold symptoms
The coat of arms featured three gold lozenges on blue
Decorative lozenges adorned the medieval manuscript margins

definitions: lubricating substance used to reduce friction between surfaces
examples: The mechanic applied lube to the squeaky door hinges
Don't forget to check the lube levels in your engine

definitions: substance such as oil or grease that reduces friction between moving parts
examples: The engine requires high-quality lubricant for optimal performance
Industrial lubricants prevent machinery from overheating during operation

definitions: application of a substance to minimize friction between surfaces in mutual contact
examples: Regular lubrication extends the lifespan of mechanical components significantly
The joints require lubrication every three months for smooth operation

definitions: purple-flowered plant of the pea family grown as fodder crop
examples: Farmers planted lucerne to feed their livestock during winter
The field of lucerne attracted numerous bees and butterflies

definitions: quality of being easily understood or having clear thinking and awareness
examples: The patient showed moments of lucidity between periods of confusion
She expressed her arguments with remarkable lucidity and precision

definitions: Satan or the devil in Christian theology
old-fashioned term for a friction match
examples: Medieval texts depicted Lucifer as a fallen angel
The preacher warned about Lucifer's temptations
He struck a lucifer to light the oil lamp
The box of lucifers sat beside the fireplace

definitions: success or failure apparently brought by chance rather than one's actions
examples: With a bit of luck, we'll arrive before sunset
She had the luck to find a parking spot immediately

definitions: simple board game where players race counters around a track
examples: The children played ludo on rainy afternoons
Ludo requires both strategy and luck to win

definitions: projecting piece by which something is held, supported, or lifted
ear or ear flap, especially in regional dialects
examples: The mechanic tightened the lugs on the wheel carefully
The pot has two lugs for easy lifting
He pulled his cap down over his lugs against the cold
The boxer took a hit to his left lug

definitions: small one or two-person sled used for racing down ice tracks
examples: Olympic athletes reached incredible speeds on the luge track
She trained for years to compete in luge racing

definitions: semi-automatic pistol originally manufactured in Germany
examples: The collector owned a vintage Luger from World War II
The museum displayed several Luger pistols in pristine condition

definitions: suitcases and bags used for carrying personal belongings while traveling
examples: Passengers collected their luggage from the carousel after landing
The hotel porter carried their luggage to the room

definitions: temporary period of quiet or reduced activity
examples: There was a brief lull in the storm before it intensified
The company experienced a lull in sales during summer

definitions: quiet gentle song sung to children to help them sleep
examples: The mother sang a soft lullaby to her restless baby
Traditional lullabies have been passed down through generations

definitions: remarkable or outstanding person or thing of its kind
examples: That storm last night was a real lulu
She told us a lulu of a story about her travels

definitions: timber sawn into rough planks or otherwise prepared for use
miscellaneous useless articles that are stored away
examples: The construction crew ordered lumber for the new deck
Pine lumber prices increased due to high demand
The attic was filled with old lumber from previous owners
She cleared out the lumber cluttering the garage

definitions: business or activity of felling trees and preparing timber
examples: Lumbering was the main industry in the Pacific Northwest
Environmental concerns have changed modern lumbering practices significantly

definitions: person who fells trees, cuts them into logs, and transports timber
examples: The lumberjack wielded his axe with practiced precision
Lumberjacks worked in camps deep within the forest

definitions: person engaged in the lumber trade or timber industry
examples: The lumberman supervised operations at the sawmill
Experienced lumbermen could estimate board feet by sight

definitions: intensity of light emitted from a surface per unit area
examples: The display's luminance was adjusted for comfortable viewing
Engineers measured the luminance of the new LED panels

definitions: person who inspires or influences others, especially in a particular sphere
natural light-giving body, especially the sun or moon
examples: She was considered a luminary in the field of genetics
Literary luminaries gathered for the annual awards ceremony
Ancient astronomers studied the movement of celestial luminaries
The moon served as the only luminary on cloudy nights

definitions: emission of light by a substance not resulting from heat
examples: Fireflies create luminescence through chemical reactions in their bodies
The cave walls showed an eerie luminescence in complete darkness

definitions: intrinsic brightness of a celestial object or other light source
examples: Astronomers calculated the star's luminosity from its apparent magnitude
The painting's luminosity came from the artist's masterful use of color

definitions: compact mass of a substance, especially without definite shape
swelling or growth under the skin
examples: She added a lump of sugar to her tea
The clay formed lumps that needed to be smoothed out
The doctor examined the lump on his neck carefully
She felt a small lump that hadn't been there before

definitions: extreme foolishness or an instance of it
state of being mentally ill, especially in legal contexts
examples: It would be sheer lunacy to invest everything in one stock
The lunacy of their plan became apparent too late
The defendant pleaded not guilty by reason of lunacy
Victorian asylums housed those deemed suffering from lunacy

definitions: person who is mentally ill, especially dangerously so
extremely foolish or eccentric person
examples: The old asylum once housed dangerous lunatics
He was certified as a lunatic and committed
Only a lunatic would attempt that dangerous stunt
She drives like an absolute lunatic on highways

definitions: meal eaten in the middle of the day
examples: They met for lunch at their favorite restaurant
She packed a healthy lunch for work every day

definitions: formal lunch or midday meal, often for a special occasion
examples: The charity luncheon raised thousands for the cause
Business executives attended the corporate luncheon at noon

definitions: time in the middle of the day when lunch is eaten
examples: The office empties quickly at lunchtime every day
Children played in the schoolyard during lunchtime

definitions: respiratory organ in humans and many animals that extracts oxygen from air
examples: The doctor listened to her lungs with a stethoscope
Smoking severely damages lung tissue over time

definitions: sudden forward thrust of the body, typically to attack
examples: The fencer made a quick lunge toward his opponent
She made a desperate lunge for the falling vase

definitions: plant of the pea family with tall spikes of colorful flowers
examples: Wild lupins covered the hillside in purple blooms
She planted lupins along the garden border for height

definitions: characteristic resembling or relating to wolves
examples: His lupine features gave him a fierce appearance
The dog's lupine ancestry was evident in its behavior

definitions: abrupt unsteady uncontrolled movement or stagger
examples: The ship gave a violent lurch in the storm
He felt his stomach lurch when the plane dropped suddenly
